page.title: 03RESIDENTIAL AREA
page.content: Chester-le-Street is a popular dormitory town,lying adjacent to the A1M and the A167 .At the start of the Ninteenth Century,Chester-le-Street's population was 11,753.Now it has risen to over 20,000. The town has new housing estates and contains some large executive houses to attract new residents.There are 2 nursery schools,6 infant schools,7 junior and 2 secondary schools. A recent survey showed that Chester -le-Street is a dormitory town,ie,many people live here but work elsewhere. Approximately 74% of its working population lie in this category.The most common reasons for living in Chester-le-Street are the good housing estates,shops,and the A1M and A167 which provide fast routes to all parts of the north east.
